data_maturity_score.evidence: Enterprise-grade tools (Erwin, IBM Infosphere), data governance practices, data warehousing concepts suggest defined processes, but lacks modern cloud-native stack signals

maturity_signals.evidence: Mentions 'data governance practices' explicitly, enterprise data modeling tools suggest structured approach

scope_creep_score.evidence: Focused role on data modeling and architecture, no mention of backend/ML/DevOps responsibilities, well-defined scope

overtime_risk_score.evidence: No work-life balance signals mentioned, consulting environment may have deadline pressure, but no explicit red flags

role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined responsibilities focused on data modeling, data architecture, and statistical models with clear technical requirements

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate concerns - location restriction, traditional tech stack, lack of modern benefits, but clear role definition and IBM stability

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: Mentions working in collaborative environment with various roles but no specific reporting structure mentioned

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No mention of manager level, reporting structure, or leadership hierarchy in job description

hiring_velocity.evidence: IBM Consulting likely has regular hiring needs for delivery centers, but no specific expansion signals

strength_details: IBM is a stable, established enterprise company with global presence
Well-defined role focused specifically on data modeling and architecture
Opportunity to work with enterprise-grade data modeling tools (Erwin, IBM Infosphere)
Collaborative environment working with cross-functional teams
concern_details: No salary, benefits, or compensation information disclosed
Location restricted to Pune, Maharashtra, India with no remote options
Traditional/legacy technology stack (Erwin, IBM Infosphere) vs modern data engineering tools
No work-life balance signals, growth opportunities, or learning support mentioned
12+ years experience requirement may be inflated for the role scope
No visa sponsorship for international candidates
best_fit_details: Senior data engineers with 10+ years experience in data modeling and architecture
Candidates with enterprise data warehouse and governance experience
Professionals seeking stable, established company environment
Those with experience in traditional data modeling tools (Erwin, IBM Infosphere)
probe_details: Ask about salary range, benefits, and total compensation package
Understand team structure, reporting lines, and career progression opportunities
Clarify the technology stack and modernization plans
Discuss work hours, overtime expectations, and work-life balance policies
Ask about learning opportunities, training, and professional development
leverage_details: Strong data modeling expertise with enterprise tools is valuable
Deep experience in data governance and data warehousing concepts
Statistical modeling and ML integration experience
summary.overall_assessment: Stable enterprise role at IBM focusing on data modeling and architecture. Good for candidates seeking established company environment with clear role definition. Main concerns are location restriction to Pune, lack of modern tech stack, missing compensation details, and limited growth signals. Traditional enterprise approach rather than modern data engineering practices.
